paragraphs.text: They would have clung to a remnant of their honour if they had said:"We are not censoring out of respect. We loathe the murderers who enforce their taboos with Kalashnikovs. But we do not want to spend years living in hiding, as Salman Rushdie did. Or be stabbed in the street, as Theo van Gogh was. Or hear an Islamist smash at our door with an axe and cry:"We will get our revenge," - as Kurt Westergaard did. So we are backing away."
